alert.note: Alert for Chittenden; Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 19 at 8:00PM EDT until September 20 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Washington County in central Vermont... Southeastern Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... * Until midnight EDT. * At 800 PM EDT, Gage reports show that between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen in western areas of Washington County including areas of Middlesex, Moretown, Duxbury and Waterbury. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding of creeks and streams is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Gages reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, secondary roads, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Middlesex, Moretown, Duxbury and Waterbury. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
